content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn about love
2. learn different languages
3. explore the world
4. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/twitter_keys.txt. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Fri May 19 10:17:52 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I was previously commanded to browse the website "https://www.worldatlas.com/articles/customs-and-traditions-from-around-the-world.html" with the question "What are some customs and traditions of different countries?" However, the website did not provide a useful answer and instead returned links to articles about travel destinations and geography. Recently, I was commanded to browse the website "https://www.culturalatlas.sbs.com.au/" with the same question. However, the command returned an error message stating that the sentence was too long in the webpage. I was then commanded to use Google to find information on customs and traditions of different countries, which returned a list of links.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide information about customs and traditions of different countries. It describes the Foreign Service Institute and its various schools and resources for U.S. government foreign affairs professionals, as well as the Transition Center for employees and family members preparing for or returning from overseas assignments. 
 
 Links: ['Skip to content (https://www.state.gov/bureaus-offices/under-secretary-for-management/foreign-service-institute/#content)', 'Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/statedept)', 'Twitter (https://twitter.com/StateDept)', 'Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/statedept/)', 'YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/user/statevideo)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides information about the culture and traditions of Saudi Arabia, including its Islamic heritage, historical role as a trade center, and Bedouin traditions. It discusses customs and traditions such as hospitality, coffee preparation, burning incense to welcome guests, the holy month of Ramadan, the Hajj pilgrimage, and the national holidays that follow them. It also mentions the importance of historic preservation, architecture, calligraphy, cultural institutions, folk music and dancing, poetry, and traditional dress and jewelry in Saudi Arabia. The text does not provide information about customs and traditions of different countries beyond Saudi Arabia. 
 
 Links: ['
The Royal Embassy of Saudi Arabia

 (https://www.saudiembassy.net/)', 'Contact Us (https://www.saudiembassy.net/contact-us)', ' (https://twitter.com/SaudiEmbassyUSA)', ' (https://www.youtube.com/user/saudiembassyusa)', ' (https://www.saudiembassy.net/culture-art)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
